comment: If possible, don't take him. He is not considerate at all and expects everything to be done his way. His lectures don't make sense and if you ask him questions, he won't explain properly. No proper office hours. No clear communication and students have to predict when Hws and exams are due. The class started out with 20 students and ended with 13.

If you want to keep your sanity do not take this professor. I took him for Strength of Materials Lab and you can follow the guidelines he sets out 110% and he will still take 10-20 points off for "material that is missing" when most of the time it is not. He is not helpful in solving problems if you have issues with your group. Avoid at all costs.

His class is pretty easy as long as you just show up and work through the problems in the book and do the homework and online quizzes. He listens to the class and makes decisions based on what the students want. I would recommend if you want a stress free class. He does ramble a bit, but he is extremely smart and loves teaching.
Cool dude just talk a little too much and most of what he says isn't on the test. Quizzes are on Chegg and the test are very difficult and nothing about what he teaches you, or are on the PowerPoint.

Should not be a professor. Cannot understand simple things such as D2L. Gives random students "grace points" because he feels like it. Grades students differently even though they made the same mistakes. Says he gives more partial credit if he is in a "good mood". Says things arent on the tests then puts them on anyways. AVOID THS PROFESSOR!!!

Very bad at teaching. Will tell you something is not going to be on the test, and then will just put it on anyways. Will tell you homework is not due one day and then will just make it due anyways. Is bad at giving partial credit. Most of the class is failing. Gives random people "grace points" w/o any explanation. No curves. Avoid at all cost.
